Text.Value: Who are you? And what do you want?

EditorData.NodeContext: Confused at the player popping up now; a little worried by it

Text.Value: So you should probably get away from the scene of the crime.
I changed my mind - I think the family should stay here after all.
This is my house, not a home for waifs and strays!

EditorData.NodeContext: Indignant/angry

Text.Value: They're extremely precious, and you shouldn't be poking around in my workshop and tampering with them!
All right, all right, I'll go! But if I'm found hanging in my cell, it'll be on your conscience.

EditorData.NodeContext: Convinced he's going to meet a grizzly end

Text.Value: Gortash doesn't run the city anymore. I dealt with him - he's no threat to you.
Not now - I'm trying to think.

EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed

Text.Value: Ugh... but if that's what it takes to get them out of my house, fine. Get on with it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bitter resignation (emphasis on "fine" because it's really not to him)

Text.Value: I found some rather sinister things in your basement.
Get out of my sight.
I gave you a chance to let them stay. Since you didn't, I'll make you.
Whatever you think you know, I'm sure some gold would help you to forget.

EditorData.NodeContext: Increasingly panicky

Text.Value: I'll deal with your squatters - just make sure you have your purse ready.
Tell me who 'they' are or you'll be dead before they even get to you.
You ought to watch those chancers you hired - I saw one of them a little too close to your pocket just now.
Then I have no use for you. Die.
I must admit I'm not quite sure why you decided to change your mind, but all's well that ends well!

EditorData.NodeContext: Confused but pleased by this turn of events

Text.Value: All right, just run and never come back.
Look, I really don't have time to chat - I'm sure you can find someone less busy to listen to you somewhere.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dismissive/distracted; has things to be getting on with

Text.Value: Whatever you're up to, it's definitely not good. I'm taking you down.
Here, take it - all of it, I don't care! You'll never see me again, I promise!

EditorData.NodeContext: Scared/anxious to offload his gold in exchange for freedom/life

Text.Value: All right - you won, you won! What more do you want from me?

EditorData.NodeContext: Panicked; worried the player is going to attack him

Text.Value: You still haven't told me who 'they' are.
Sounds like you're in over your head. All right - get going.
Well, if you talk to me like that, I'm definitely not going to help you.
You're going to jail - I found the explosive toy bears you 'donated'.
Please don't - I'm not the villain here! You could put a stop to the whole operation.

EditorData.NodeContext: Panicked

Text.Value: Purse? You said you'd get rid of them free of charge!

EditorData.NodeContext: Indignant/angry

Text.Value: All's well that ends well, eh? I'm sure the Guild will be in touch with any concerns.

EditorData.NodeContext: Scared (worried the player might turn on him as they just killed the thugs he hired)

Text.Value: What's this, bribery? The only place you're going is prison.
Keep it together, Arfur. There's no evidence that links this back to you, and you definitely locked the basement before you left.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to calm himself in his internal monologue

Text.Value: I could just kill you, but I'm giving you a chance. I suggest you take it.
The teddy bears were an experiment - my greatest invention. A clever little device in their chest allows them to speak.

EditorData.NodeContext: Anxious but also frustrated; he's definitely quite proud of his explosive teddy bears

Text.Value: Nine Hells - you followed me all the way here? What could you possibly want with me now?

EditorData.NodeContext: Deeply exasperated

Text.Value: Please don't! What do you want from me? It's not my fault - I was forced to do this. Framed, even!

EditorData.NodeContext: Panicked/scared of the player and their threats; keen to protest his (false) innocence

Text.Value: Probe his mind for the truth.
But there's more. Smokepowder, inside the device. I collect packages from Felogyr's Fireworks in the Lower City, and stuff the bears with it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Fearful - clearly doesn't like recounting this

Text.Value: So you'd rather kill children than risk your own skin?
You can't be serious - they'll find me. A cell won't keep me safe! They run this city.

EditorData.NodeContext: Terrified

Text.Value: I'm sure a man of your means can find room at an inn somewhere.
And what is it that you want?

EditorData.NodeContext: Still somewhat annoyed

Text.Value: The Rivington Rats don't waste any time, do they? I can see why they were so highly recommended...

EditorData.NodeContext: Morbidly in awe at the Rivington Rat's brutal efficiency

Text.Value: Leave.
You don't know what they're capable of. I'd rather die by your hand than let them get hold of me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Scared; mouth running away with him

Text.Value: Fine - just give me the gold and I'll let you go.
I've found the toys you donated - care to explain before everything blows up in your face?
I don't know who's in charge - but it starts at the fireworks shop. That's where the packages come from.

EditorData.NodeContext: Anxiously thinking aloud

Text.Value: Really - there's no 'this' and nothing to get to the bottom of!

EditorData.NodeContext: Exasperated (and emphasis on "really"; rhetorical expression of annoyance as opposed to a question/assertion)

Text.Value: The squatters are gone - the house is all yours.
Bloody Zenovia and her bloody Rats - truly no honour among their kind. And you - what do you want?

EditorData.NodeContext: Frustrated/irritated
EditorData.logicalname: RATS GONE: Left without payment after pushed about basement

Text.Value: So what are your plans now?
Go there - tell them Uncle Felogyr sent you, and they'll show you the smokepowder. Lots of it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Anxious

Text.Value: A shame they had to die - but they brought it on themselves. And I'm the one who has to clean up the mess.
It doesn't stop with Gortash - his people are everywhere, choking the life out of the city. If I stay here, they'll kill me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Panicked

Text.Value: If you've been there, you know more than I do. Now will you please let me go?
Here's your payment as we agreed.

EditorData.NodeContext: Business-like

Text.Value: Anyway, I have a lot to do now those squatters are out of my hair. Goodbye.

EditorData.NodeContext: Distracted; the player is getting in his way now

Text.Value: All right, all right - just don't hurt me!

EditorData.NodeContext: Scared of the player and trying to placate them

Text.Value: Sinister? Nonsense. Those are experimental toys - guaranteed to bring a smile to the face of even the unhappiest child.
Thanks, but I'll need all your gold too.
A room can wait. After what you've put me through, I need a drink.
Oh, I will! Thank you! Thank you so much!

EditorData.NodeContext: So ridiculously grateful at having been allowed to live

Text.Value: Keep your gold - I want answers.
I haven't got anything else to say to you. Leave me alone - do you think you can manage that?

EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed/angry
EditorData.logicalname: CHASED OUT: Failed to Intimidate HasMet

Text.Value: Give me the gold and we'll call it quits.
Not because I want to - because I have to. Otherwise they'll kill me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Matter of fact (but a little too excited about seeing them in action before catching himself)

EditorData.logicalname: THANKED: Zenovia Killed, RATS GONE (no fight with merchant))

Text.Value: I've got so much to do now - I'd really better get on with it. Excuse me, would you?

EditorData.NodeContext: Distracted; the player is getting in his way now

Text.Value: Now I have to figure out what I'm going to do...

EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed as the refugees are still taking up his house

Text.Value: What? No, wait!

EditorData.NodeContext: Panicked; he's about to be attacked by the player

Text.Value: But you said you'd get rid of them! And I believed you - more fool me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Indignant/angry then resigned/regretful

Text.Value: Thank you so much for your interest but it's really none of your concern, is it, hm? Excuse me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dismissive/a little sarcastic

Text.Value: I'm here to see you are brought to justice.
Yes you locked the basement, but it didn't help. Whatever you're up to, it ends now. I'm taking you down.
It sounds terrible when you put it like that. But maybe you can put a stop to this whole operation.

EditorData.NodeContext: Regretful

Text.Value: Don't deny it - I know it was you! You stole my gold! Unless it was one of those filthy squatting vermin...

EditorData.NodeContext: Furious

Text.Value: I'm just a simple toymaker - an artisan! I don't know anything!

EditorData.NodeContext: Keen to protest his (false) innocence

Text.Value: They would've killed me if I refused to rig the toys - and they're definitely going to kill me now!

EditorData.NodeContext: Panicking quite visibly now

Text.Value: Leave.
I'm no more 'in cahoots' with Gortash than you are. Which is to say I'm just as much under his thumb as anyone else in this city.
'They'? Who's this 'they'?
I can't tell you. I won't tell you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Panicky

Text.Value: If I were after gold, I would have gutted you and taken it.
It won't end with him - his people are everywhere. But I'll go quietly. Maybe I have a chance.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resigned (but still a little scared)

Text.Value: What? How? Nine Hells...

EditorData.NodeContext: Blindsided by the player knowing his secret; growing concern

Text.Value: I'm strongly considering killing you myself.
I'll get to the bottom of this one way or another.
Finally, those awful squatters are gone! I can feel everything unclenching already.

EditorData.NodeContext: Relieved that the squatters have been ejected from his house

Text.Value: At least in a prison there'll be walls to break through before anyone can get to you.
Would you keep it down? Or do you want to get us both killed?
I've been to Felogyr's. So you're in cahoots with Gortash.
You again. Did you need something?

EditorData.NodeContext: Mildly annoyed by the player's presence but willing to humour them

Text.Value: Sorry, but you had your chance. Now you die.
Uh... not that I want to die by your hand, of course. I'll leave - risk the roads - say goodbye to the city forever.

EditorData.NodeContext: Suddenly realising what he's said; backpedalling and trying to convince the player not to harm him

Text.Value: I want the family to stay. You have room for them, surely?
No! I'll be trapped like a rat.

EditorData.NodeContext: Panicked

Text.Value: How do you...?

EditorData.NodeContext: Startled

Text.Value: Haven't you got anything better to do with your time than harass innocent craftspeople?

EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed

EditorData.logicalname: CHASED OUT (by bandits): Zenovia Killed, RATS GONE (no fight with merchant))

Text.Value: How about putting you in the ground?
At long last!

EditorData.NodeContext: Jubilant that he has his house back

Text.Value: There, I told you what you wanted to know. Now will you let me go?

EditorData.NodeContext: Anxious again; really wants to get out of here

Text.Value: Trying to use magic on me, are you? This conversation is over if you can't take a professional craftsman at his word.

EditorData.NodeContext: Indignant anger

Text.Value: I found the explosive toy bears you 'donated' to the refugees.
*His plea comes with an offering - a pass, granting you access to the Lower City.*
Look, I'm sorry, all right? I just really need them out of my house as soon as possible. Please.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to catch himself/be civil despite his annoyance

Text.Value: Appreciate it. But now I know all that, I don't think I can let you go - sorry.
I've told you everything - and, in the end, no one was hurt. Please, just let me go!
If the Guild come asking, I'll be making it very clear that you took it upon yourself to kill their thugs. I had nothing to do with it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Scared (worried the player might turn on him as they just killed the thugs he hired)
EditorData.logicalname: Zenovia Killed, RATS GONE (no fight with merchant)

Text.Value: It was the little one, wasn't it? Tch, knew I couldn't trust him.

EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed/"I knew it" tone

Text.Value: No. You'll die here.
You're only compounding your guilt! I have friends in high places - you'll pay dearly for this.

EditorData.NodeContext: Indignant and threatening

Text.Value: Well... with Zenovia and the others gone, I don't suppose you'll take no for an answer.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resigned/weary; sees no other option

Text.Value: All right - they can stay. Are you happy now?

EditorData.NodeContext: Bitter

Synopsis: General dialogue for the merchant after the Rivington Rats leave and/or if the player makes a choice in the WYR_MerchantsHouse_Merchant_Conflict dialogue that ends it.
